Review: The AccuWeather app used to be quite accurate, but a year or two ago changes were made which have greatly deteriorated the quality of the forecasts.  Even with a specific address in place the Minutecast shows rain when it is not raining and no rain or coloration on the map when it is.  The temperatures are off by 810 degrees.  The wind speed is accurate only part of the time.  The new app is also less user friendly.  I use the old one to check on the month as a whole but that's about it.  This app serves for a very general picture if the weather... hot, cold, windy .... but it does not reflect actual weather anymore then the NOAA does.  I find that Weather Underground is the most reliable and specific weather app here in Rio Rancho, NM.
Label: Dep

Clearing in the afternoon.

I also had a problem on the iPhone when I was adding my water after midnight. I was on the proper date, the day prior, but what I added went into the current aftermidnight day. Review: I have Afib and rely on my Fitbit charge 2 for average resting heart rate info and the monthly graphs of such to show Doctor. Now I am beginning to wonder if the daily resting average is even correct as it has been 60 bpm every day since Oct 11th.  It is very unusual for the resting average to remain the same for that long.  I have called and spent a good bit of time talking to support.  It was decided that it wasn't the tracker itself, but in the app  Anyway it was turned over to someone else to study and find out problem.  Was given a case number.  Said I would be contacted by email. Haven't heard anything as of yet. I may have to find another heart rate tracker if this is not resolved.

Review: Google maps has a illexecuted feature where it will find a faster route  redirect you to save time. This time is often less than 5 minutes. Unfortunately I've witnessed multiple occasions where, without fail, Google will redirect me while I am merging on the freeway, causing me to divert my attention from the road to my phone. The option to decline is too small and requires precise tapping. This needs to be an optional feature that you can turn off. Its timing is terrible and dangerous. I've submitted this as app feedback but I can't in good conscience recommend this app until that feature becomes optional.

Review: The filters offered within this application are really quite fun. When I choose to post a picture, I find myself applying all of the filters to see which one I like best. Since you have to select each filter individually and wait for the processing, this can be time consuming. There are some hidden features, in the sense that it's not obvious they are there. You can drag you finger left right on the image to change the intensity of the effect. You can swipe down to create a split screen and move it around but it's a little clumsy. Also, if you want to save the image and post it, those are individual steps instead of selecting multiple actions at once. There is one thing I am unhappy about. You can't change the location assigned to a posted image and they use your current location instead of the location the photo was taken. Since I tend to up load photos once I am home, the location information is always incorrect. I would like the ability to apply the filters on my computer. I'm going to try and print some of the images just to see what happens. I really like the idea of this application, but it's not a mature offering yet.
Label: Usa

Review: The filters are unique and interesting. Unfortunately, it's not uncommon for it to crash when selectingapplying a style. The lag time for processing isn't too bad considering the nature of the filters, but it could be better. Also, it is difficult to adjust the intensity of the effects it's rather haphazard trying to even get it to pull up. Overall, 45 for it's features you can't really customize an effect that I can see and 35 for functionality. It's discouraging to use the app with all it's potential if it keeps crashing. I'd rather the developers improve the features already present and their functionality before introducing anything new.
Label: Per,Usa

Review: I intended to use this version of Acrobat for portable proof reading of documents created on a computer. These are big documents which require frequent revision, and I like to be able to proof read at times I'm away from the computer. Towards that end, I'm using Dropbox, and frequently replacing the file. Unfortunately, there seems to be no way to refresh the file in Acrobat, so I'm totally stuck looking at an old version of this file. I tried deactivating Acrobat so it will reboot, but that still doesn't refresh. As such, this app is completely useless to me and thus gets but a single star rating. It is very rare that I rate an app so low, and it makes me especially unhappy as I'm paying monthly the ridiculously high fees for an Adobe CC subscription

Review: I have traded emails with Adobe support. The popup side bar can be deactivated by going to the multitasking tab in iOS General tab and turning off Multitasking. When multitasking is turned on, a user can be using an application and do a side swipe that theoretically will show all other apps that function in split screen. If I open Safari and do this, only Acrobat pops up in that list and shows all the documents linked to Acrobat. When I open Acrobat and do a side swipe, several apps show up in that side bar. This leads me to believe the issue isn't Acrobat related, but iOS related.

Then, after your current subscription has ended, you can purchase a Family Plan.

My wife contacted Joni Moss who lived in our community and we heard nothing but good things about . Came to our house told us what we needed to do and was truly honest to us the whole time. I'm 52 years old I've really never met a salesman so honest that truly wants to help you and your family . Because of this we were able to buy our dream home in Ashaway Rhode Island , my daughter is playing softball one is heading to college , my wife who is from New England is back home, thank you Joni Moss and Zillow our daughters picked out our new home on this site.

Review: I'm in American who lives in Mexico fulltime. I moved here in March from Texas. This application lets me do everything that I've ever dreamed of and more as a Spanish conversion application. For example, I can dictate a phrase or an email in English and it converts into Spanish for me in real time. I can enter into Spanish word and it converts it to English. I can use the photo feature on this and take a picture of text in Spanish and it converts it in real time in English. It also does pronunciations so I can continue to practice my Spanish.  In short, I've never seen a thing like this and I am completely thrilled. I've never written a review for an application although I'm a long time Apple user. And I'm happy to report this is a five out of five application.  PS I have taught my 71yearold mother how do use this application as well. And she loves it Thomas in San Miguel Mexico
Label: Usa

Review: It's been a year since my first review and it's still impossible to track Pokemon within the game. Worse yet, garbage Pokemon still hold priority on the nearby list. I was two feet away from a Snorlax the other day and fortunately I stumbled onto it because the only Pokemon on my nearby were Spinarak and Pidgey. I'm not even in a super rural area, so I can't imagine how awful it still is for players out in the country. Since raids were introduced, my app has crashed literally hundreds of times over a 23 week span, so Ill update this review yet again when I can assess how this recent patch fixes crashes on iPhone 6. Obviously the game is enjoyable considering I've been playing since launch, but it's disappointing to look back and see that in all that time Niantic still hasn't fixed a number of obvious flaws within the game. Review: Pokmon go, is an awesome game, but apparently Niantic isn't very concerned about how many people play their game because of the recent updates. All this began when the time for Pokmon to spawn was changed from 5 to 10. Not a big deal, it was still fun and promoted walking. Then, there was a small grace period before they released their second fatal  update. They scrapped their tracking system. SERIOUSLY THEY REMOVED THE ONLY WAY TO FIND POKMON ACCURATELY That also removed all third party scanners, which literally was the only reason most of the players actually went to catch Pokmon. But more advanced trackers like FPM survived. Then they killed any form of hope by adding a captcha robot detector feature. Which removed all the advanced third party scanners. Being able to actually know where the Pokmon I wanted to catch were was the only reason I played Pokmon go. But I still played for a while by riding my bike and running certain trails. But then, the final straw was when Pokmon ceased to appear if you walked, ran or biked too fast. Now, all I can do in Pokmon go is walk around at the speed of Old man to catch a pidgey or two. Or if I'm lucky, a rare and elusive rattata. That's how much I care at this point. Pokmon go lost like 90 of its players because of Niantic's wrong decisions. Also, seriously, the buddy system is is complete and total garbage. Let me walk 5km to get 1 candy for my eevee And don't forget about Pokmon go's high end nearby tracking system. Which is completely broken. There was a koffing on the last slot which means it was the farthest away and suddenly it appears right in front of me. All in all, I don't think Niantic even cares about this game anymore. They removed key features and made the game unplayable.
Label: Sup,Usa

Review: I have been playing Pokmon Go since release, me while I am a huge fan, I need Niantic to get their act together and help out us rural players. I am going to list out all of the things wrong with rural playing, and give pointers on how to fix.
Label: Usa

Review: First of all, spawns are an absolute joke out in rural areas. Since then you have increased spawn rates, however all that has accomplished is increase the amount of crappy Pokmon that I come across. Please Niantic, increase RARER spawns, because even a rock or fire Pokmon gets me excited at this point.
Label: Mis

Review: Second of all, while the new gym system is MUCH improved from the older system, it still has its flaws. The first is the 50 coin max, as the limited gyms in these areas are always changing hands. That way, is you hold a gym for longer it's really an accomplishment OUT in rural areas, yet no real reward is given. The other thing that needs to be changed is less about rural areas, but if more then one Pokmon get knocked out in the same day, only the first rewards coins. This feature is absolutely ABSURD considering we still worked to get those other gyms, yet get no reward.
Label: Mis

Review: The third feature that needs changing is raids. I love the feature, as it has already helped me to get several new Pokmon. HOWEVER, in rural areas, good raids are far and few between. So when I find something like a Snorlax or Tyranitar raid I get really excited. That's all well in good, except for the fact that their cp is too high to beat without any other players nearby, remember that rural thing so I have never beaten ANY OF THEM Still don't have A Tyranitar
Label: Mis

Review: The fourth is being led into by my third, and that is the new legendary raids. Legendaries have been hyped up ever since the game came out, and not only am I sorely disappointed but I will never get one. Again, good raids are far and few between, so finding a legendary raid is hard enough. Then I can never beat one because there are no players that play near me to help with the raid. And say that for some reason I actually do complete a raid which I won't then the catch rate is THREE PERCENT To make it fairer, I think they should do two things. One of which is a suggestion and the other is something that absolutely needs to happen. I think a good idea would be that the legendary raid cp should not be a determined thing, and should be created by the amount of people who are in the actual raid. That way it would still be really hard, but not impossible for rural players to complete. The other thing that needs to be implemented is the increasing catch rate of legendaries to at least 15 considering beating them is hard enough. Label: Mis

Review: This app is virtually flawless  and the only thing keeping it from being my go to drawing tool is the lack of additional technical tools. Give me a ruler, give me an ellipse guide, give me a rectangle tool. This is the one area that apps such as Sketchbook Pro really shine  it has great art tools, and great tools that support the art tools. Procreate has exceptional art tools, but lacks any additional tools to support those art tools  and in my opinion, this is what causes Procreate to fall a bit short. The addition of the new draw assist tool in SBP was a total game changer  being able to ink panels on the fly and illustrate flawless ellipses, lines, squares, etc has made that app PERFECT for both rapid concepting and professional production level art. Procreate will dominate once it has a broader toolset than just customizable brushes.
Label: Mis

Review: The brushes are very customizable, and this app has a professional feel. However, I feel as if this app is best for people trying to draw traditionalesque painting, not comics or similar styles. There are lineart tools, but what would make this app more accommodating would be features like clipping layers, alpha lock, a paint bucket tool, and a selection layer where you can draw on selection instead of just using the lasso tool. I haven't explored this app completely but I'm pretty sure it doesn't have those tools. Other than that, it's perfect for sketching and painting  as the app advertises.
Label: Mis

Review: I am new to drawing, taking my first lessons. I used Linea for the first 2 weeks, and I still love it for it's simplicity, with just enough options to make it a very fun and useful sketch app. Yet, I soon yearned for more options, and downloaded Procreate. At first, I missed the great simple options and controls of Linea, but by day 2 the power and beauty yes,  well functioning apps are a thing of beauty to me came through and I only use Procreate now.  While I am practicing beginning methods of sketching, I am also learning Procreate, which in itself offers many AHA moments when I learn how to do something I initially could not figure out.
Label: Mis

Review: With that said, if you are reading this and thinking of buying Procreate, do not hesitate... this app is simply amazing... even for the beginner Part of the joy is the terrific online support and forums. I have not had a question I could not readily find an answer to by searching the web. This app is worth so much more than the 4.99... kudos to the Procreate team and all the amazing users who have enabled me to find answers to my questions.
Label: Mis

Review: Organization  The app itself is organized, the clean look and theme makes it a clean workplace to work on.
Label: Mis

Review: Brushes  The brush settings are what I've been looking for my entire life, settings that actually affect the brush The number of brushes are remarkable, each with their own texture. The ability to make and import custom brushes was a great touch, I'm honestly grateful for it.
Label: Mis

Review: Canvas Measurements  Thank goodness, I don't have to struggle converting pixels into whatever unit anymore, they're also effective and I love them.
Label: Mis

Review: Palette Customization  This feature is so smooth, I can just tap instead of drag or whatever else is excessive. It's so easy to just create palettes or artworks.
Label: Mis

Review: Adjustments  The best feature actually,  I have never seen an IOS application with the adjustments. e.g Gaussian Blur
Label: Mis

Review: SelectionLasso Tool  The Lasso Tool the tool with the S for an icon is useful in coloring in my opinion. However, freehand selection is often risky since you have to continue along. It would be nice to have a magnetic lasso tool like in Adobe Photoshop CC for people with unsteady hands like myself to use. Also a Select Pen should be added, like the one present in Medibang Paint, it would really help in coloring finer details since Automatic Selections tend to leave a few pixels, leaving the user to have to fill it in manually.
Label: Mis

Review: So far, I appreciate the app, though it could use a couple more upgrades here and there. The Magnetic Lasso and the Select Pen is what I'm really looking out for if there will be a future update for the app.

Review: I was hyped when this game was coming out. I payed the 10 of course because I love Nintendo. It looked incredible but once it came out I got it day one I pretty much just started drifting from it and stopped playing it. I'm just being honest. The graphics and visuals are incredible and well done, but how the game plays is just meh. I found myself very irritated playing it. I agree with other reviews on this, but not being able to move back is rage inducing. If anything kept me playing at all, it was the additional characters. But that was not pulling me in enough to keep me playing. Overall, the graphics are incredible but just how the game was designed to play was just a bad idea.
Label: Usa

Review: Now, the biggest flaw that I have found thus far. When you max out your Toads it will make it extremely difficult to collect more Toads of a certain color. If you are like me, you have collected everything but the 2500 Toads required to obtain the classic Luigi statue. Every time you win a rally it will appear you have been given the appropriate amount of Toads, but check again. I usually only get about half of the color Toad it says I got when I win a rally while I'm maxed out. This made it very difficult to get the 2500 green toads I needed. I was finally able to achieve it by losing a few rallies on purpose that didn't require betting any green Toads, but it took way longer than it should have. Nintendo, please fix this bug, or please remove the Toad limit
Label: Usa

Review: Overall, it's a fantastic game I would have given it 5 stars if it weren't for the annoying maxed out Toad bug. Maybe Nintendo will fix that and I will change my review. Until then it's a solid 4 star game and worth the price

If you want the main subject and the background processed differently, you have to select the subject and do your stuff, then commit those changes and go through the making process again but inverted to change the rest. I also wish there was an option to have the mask shown as a particular color so you can easily see what is and isn't part of the mask. Overall, though, this was WELL worth the money.

Review: I had to get this app for work when we switched from Schedule fly. While schedule fly doesn't have an app, it can be set up to send a text when a shift becomes available for pickup, and it sends texts if any message is received. In hotschedules there's no option to get app notifications or texts that a shift has been put up, the only way you can find out is to constantly open  check the app calendar. This is a huge drawback to this app for workers that like to pick up shifts. Hot schedules also only sends a text if a message from a manager is received. It does do a badge alert for coworkers messages, but it would be nice to have an option of text notifications too. Hope these options are considered for the next update
Label: Mis

Review: After trying many of the other 7minute workout apps, I conclude that this one is my personal favorite, note the personal. Most of the other one require you to pay for other features when this app gives it after the initial purchase. The workout itself is amazing because I can keep my device turned off and the workout will still continue. The addons in this app are also great, but I feel like the initial workout is enough. The reasons why I gave this a 45 instead of a 55 is because of the lack of updates and the improvements there could be on the app to accommodate more recent devices, like the iPhone 6 or 7. Since it is out of date, the app drains a bit more battery on newer devices than it does on older ones your device will send you a notification of this issue when using the app as a reminder. In the end, this is a very good app for those who, like myself, do not have the time to workout for long periods of time in an expensive gym. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone.
Label: Per,Sup

Review: I have to say that after using this app compared to the multitude of other weather notification apps that I have, I am not impressed at all. I live in Savannah, GA where we get some pretty bad weather from time to time and I like to know when that weather is on my back door. Just recently we had a mild tornado outbreak, as well as a slew of severe thunderstorms. Of all of the apps that I have for weather with the notifications turned on, NOAA was the very last app to give me a notification that the storm was happening, and at times that notification was almost an hour after the storm had passed. If this was the only app that I had giving me notifications, my family and myself could have wound up seriously injured or worse if just one of those tornado producing storms had hit my house and I was relying on this app. The sad thing is that this is a paid app, that I purchased for a little bit of reassurance during bad weather to give me some piece of mind and the only thing it has done is make me more weary about severe weather in my area. And for anyone that reads this and is wondering, this has not been the only time that the app has been extremely delayed in letting me know that there was bad weather approaching. It happened in April, as well as January, during the tornado outbreak across GA. So basically, it's not a fluke.
Label: Dep

Don't know why they can't locate us and give accurate weather.

Review: This app has always had two significant issues that make it impractical. 1. It always starts incredibly zoomed in, meaning you have to pinch zoomout several times to see incoming weather. I don't know about you, but I can usually tell if it's raining at my current location by opening my eyes. I need to know what's on the way, not what's already here. 2. When you begin zooming out, your city's name pops up in a bubble that covers the city and, in my case, a significant portion of my state. This blocks my view of the weather itself. And I live in a rather large Midwestern state, so it's ridiculous that the city name scales larger and larger as you zoom out, covering the state. It's just bad design, and I don't know why no one else is bothered by the poor functionality and lack of customization. This isn't worth 4.
Label: Dep,Usa

Review: Here's today's forecast from another popular app 'Cloudy skies this morning followed by thunderstorms this afternoon. A few storm may be severe.'  This app '.......'. That's right it doesn't give you a forecast for today. And if I hadn't watched the weatherman this morning I wouldn't know today has the potential of having a severe weather outbreak. Forecasts for days in the future consist of two words at most. Inexplicably Saturday is forecast as 'Clear.' But the chance of rain is 70. Tomorrow shows 'Light rain.'  Chance of rain, 0. Makes no sense. Why this app gets such a high rating is a mystery to me. If you live an area where severe weather is common don't get this. Even if you don't it's poorly done.

It also integrates with Siri, and knows that the Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything is exactly 42. If you're just going to buy a trivia app then this is the one for you. Review: I used this app on a loaner iPad, and I pulled it out every night before I started my commute home. Working up on a hill, it was easy to see the night sky and to compare it to Star Walk's wonderinducing app. Using GPS and a teeny tiny gyroscope, it sensed my ever move of the iPad  up, down, pointing overhead  even pointing down to the ground so I could imagine what my Chilean friends would be viewing. It was therefore the first app I bought when I was gifted my very own first gen iPad, and it still works beautifully. Star Walk shows more than the stars and planets all man made satellites and the ISS are tracked and shown as well. I like having the option to view the screen in bright white on black or in night mode using a red palette.

Also, pretty pretty please add a voice to text button. Another complaint is about the emojis. Why am I stuck with the default old emojis There are so many fun new ones and I hate the yellow original ios ones. My final complaint is, I wish when I pressed and held the Swype button to change keyboards, it operated like the iOS keyboard and bitmoji and by that I mean, show a list of the other keyboards instead of next keyboard. Other than those things, Swype has improved my Apple experience immeasurably.

But if the thing that matters most to you is being able to Swype when you text then this app is for you. And a big plus for me is not having to switch to the number keyboard to type numbers and symbols which I absolutely hate a long press gets you there. You do have to learn where the symbols are hiding but it's worth it. Kudos Swype on being the best swipe keyboard out there

That said, why is it you cannot fix the issues that have plagued the app since day one Autocorrect cannot be turned off. The toggle onoff button is useless. This is how it has always been. Of course, nobody wants it permanently off, but I'd rather that than deal with Autocorrect's habit of changing common words to the most obscure word possible. When I type awesome, why are you changing it to sardine How often do you think the word sardine is used by your average English speaker You can't fix this And finally the personal dictionary. Why have an option of manually adding words to my personal dictionary when you will add them on your own You add email addresses and other useless words to the dictionary with no input from me. These issues have been prevalent for years.

Review: The app worked okay until I went to renew my subscription.  I was charged 4.99 for the renewal through iTunes, but never got the renewal.  I played emailphone tag with the company, Navionics, but every time I called them it was at least a two hour wait time on hold ...TWO HOURS ON HOLD  Then, Navionics blamed iTunes and iTunes blamed Navionics for me not getting the renewal I paid 4.99 for.  Neither Navionics nor iTunes will correct this problem because they're both blaming the other for the problem.  Meanwhile, I got burned out of 4.99 FOR NOTHING.  To add insult to injury, I've paid for other in app purchases through this same app, but if I can't renew the subscription they're WORTHLESS.  At least 30.00 wasted and Navionics nor iTunes cares one bit about it.
Label: Mis

Good to know where the real shallows and rocks are though.

Review: The app works great for its intended purpose but it has a flaw that ruins it. For some reason they placed a very light colored link that easily blends into the background to something called openstreet. It is placed right in the middle lower section so almost every time you try to scroll your map, the link will get activated and it takes you to this website and away from your map. It is very worrisome if you are tracking your way points through a tough channel and suddenly your map is gone. I have the paid version of navionics too. If they could get rid of that stupid link it could be a great app.

Review: Literally the most beneficial fishing tool I have ever came across, specifically when targeting areas ice fishing, due to the fact that, unlike most chat plotters used on open water, most ice flashers do not have any means of navigation or topography. Simply pull out your phone and hop on the sled to quickly target designated contour areas and composition changes. An absolute game changer. Best part... ITS FREE. Why not spend the money on the rods we know your gonna buy anyways because when do we ever stop buying new fishing gear. I will also have you know this is the only app review I have ever written, due mainly because I'm pretty confident I use this app more then the text messaging and calling features on my phone.

Also it's great to be able to download areas so that I don't need cellular coverage to use the maps. Well worth the 10 bucks. Thanks

I am part of an old boat club and recommend this app to everyone. I am amazed by this app every time I use it.

Review: I spend most of my time fishing along the east coast of Florida in a 20' CC. I thought about buying an expensive GPS unit for my boat but found that Navionics does all that I need. What sold me on this App I put in at a very little off the chart boat ramp one afternoon to go shrimping and the channel out was marked by PCV pipes with shallows on either side.  Coming in well after sunset I could not find these little PVC markers so, Navionics to the rescue I just followed my out bound Track right back in. It put me between these little PCV markers that I could not even see until I was passing them.  Worth every penny and saved me hundred of dollars. No need for a GPS unit.
Label: Mis

You can't go wrong for the price  Like I said best navigation and chart app in the apple App Store

The auto route had me going across sand bars and islands Needs some serious tweaking

Review: Caveat emptor as app uses true not magnetic for course and direction. If you are in an area of high magnetic variation and do not account for it manually then you will miss your mark. Remember 1 degree of course error in 60 miles is 1 mile.

Review: I've been using this app to navigate from the Chesapeake Bay area down to Florida and love it I'm delivering a 50 foot catamaran and the electronics on board are useless. I've had to rely on this app on both my iPhone and iPad and it had been extremely helpful. The ease of use is great, accuracy has not been a problem, and pulling into new inlets every night has been easy with this app.

Review: It does have a few issues. I use the track quite often to see the days progress. The problem is I leave the app running in the background and it usually crashes about twice a day. When it does this the track line is connected with a dotted line to show what it missed, which is great. However, the information at the end of the day is not correct due to it keeps the same start time, but only tells the tracks distance from the last startup point. This makes the total distance, average speed, and fuel consumption way off.
Label: Dep

It shows 3 feet if water where the U.S. Sailboat show is currently setting up deepdraft boats for display. In New York harbor, it shows less than 20 feet of water in Northern Stapleton anchorage, where deepdraft ships are anchored. Don't rely on the soundings.

Review: Sweet app out of the box on my 3GS. I was looking for depth charts for the Tennessee river lakes in North Alabama Guntersville, Wheeler, Wilson, and Pickwick. I'm glad I ignored most of the negative reviews. Within minutes I had 500 MB of charts downloaded covering a large chunk of the southeast at no added cost. Resolution is great and accurate so far according to my sonar. Community overlays are a sweet feature too. App also allows overlays of mapping services Google, Bing, etc. Great app so far, and well worth 10. Now I don't need to spend 20 per lake for paper maps
Label: Mis

Tracking routes in shallow water is very important, bc when you try to go back to a spot someone else took you, you will find out they know those waters well and make it look easy.  This is where this app comes most handy for me.

Review: I am a fisherman for inland lakes.   This is a gem of an app.  It has a high level of functionality and is as handy as your iPhone.  I find it very useful.  I use it a lot when fishing with friends in their boats.  I can mark a spot and transfer it later to my boat's GPS.  I have also used it, with the guide's permission, to record waypoints when on a guided trip.   It also works excellent when navigating to waypoints.  It gives you a current heading while under way and I have found it to be very accurate, both in recording waypoints and also finding spots.   I also feel secure having a backup to my main navigation GPS when on my boat that is potent enough to get'r done if I were to need it for something critical like finding your way out of some of the jungles in Texas lakes.   This is a HIGH value app at 10.
Label: Mis

Review: I bought this app last spring and used it for fishing on 5 or 6 lakes in N Texas.  This is a great app for the price. I used it more prior to fishing to mark spots etc.. Once on the lake, It took me right to the spot I picked out and I could also mark a spot for future reference. The only real problem I had was if you mark say a good Crappie hole on the map, everybody who has this app now knows exactly where ur spot is.  For the price, not a bad app. Use it w a depth  fish finder and it will guide u to ur location.

Also it's been a good tool to use if baby hasn't moved around a lot in the day  when I put my phone on my belly the pressure and the noise really makes baby move around. So perhaps that's the problem To be fair, I complained to the developer and they responded quickly, however they basically gave me the instructions on how to use the app quiet room, find your heartbeat first, try the different mode, etc which I had already been doing. I never pay for apps so this one was a disappointment... and I really was hoping it would work. Next baby I will buy a stethoscope.
Label: Mis

Review: After reading all of the positive reviews, I was excited about this app.  We thought it would be a more affordable option than buying a heart monitor in retail and we wanted to be able to checkin on the baby throughout the pregnancy because we had complications in the past.  Unfortunately, I never once could hear my little ones' heartbeat which was shocking considering we never had issues finding or holding onto a heartbeat in the doctors office. I tried the developer's suggestions to find a quiet room and I also tried to listen at multiple times throughout the day and it never worked.  Even at 39 weeks, I never heard a heartbeat regardless of where I positioned it.  In fact, I had a hard time even capturing my own heartbeat . I gave it two stars because it is easy to use good navigation and userfriendly and offers some good features but since I wasn't able to ever hear a heart beat it was a waste of money.  Since everyone's pregnancy is different, it could just be that I wasn't a good candidate for this type of thing...maybe it would work better for others

I could hear baby's heartbeat beating away at 8.5 weeks It was a little faint but I could definitely tell that that's what it was. I am now 11 weeks and the heartbeat is much louder and more distinct. When using this app, you do need to be in a quiet place, and it does take a little bit to get used to the difference between the white noise and baby's heartbeat. However, once you find it it's very obvious that it is the heartbeat. Definitely beats the cost of paying for a Doppler and works beautifully. Highly recommend

Review: I was skeptical but as an extremely excited dad i felt this app would be an extra  connection to my baby for me if it worked. We tried early on at week 8 and couldnt get anything. We tried again every few weeks. After week 24 we kind of gave up until week 32. It didnt take 20 seconds and could hear it loud and clear. It was music to my ears. I give the app 5 stars bc it does everything it claims to do. It also says that you get the best results between week 3040, which was true in my case. So i say the app is worth the money cheaper than doplar, but wait till at least week 25 to try.

Review: Im at 28 weeks, and I was able to listen to my babys heart beat You just need to follow the instructions theres a video. Label: Mis

Review: I have had this app downloaded since I was maybe 15 weeks pregnant. Since my placenta is in the back of my uterus, I have had no issues feeling my sweet baby boy move since 15 weeks or hearing his sweet little heart beat with this since 23 weeks. I am now 30 weeks and I can find his heart beat every day with this. Its very good and Im happy this is free because I didnt want to spend 60 on a doppler. I totally recommend this app to any pregnant woman who wants to hear their sweet bub. I would suggest waiting until around 25 weeks to make sure you can actually can pick up the heart beat, but dont be discouraged if you dont at that point. The app suggests you wait until youre between 30 and 40 weeks and I have had no difficulty finding his heart beat now that I am 30 weeks. Earlier it was a little bit difficult. Make sure you use airplane mode when youre looking for the heart beat though and that youre in a quiet room.
Label: Mis
